name: WISECONDOR
tagline: WIthin-SamplE COpy Number aberration DetectOR: Detect fetal trisomies and smaller CNV's in a maternal plasma sample using whole-genome data.
body:
### Welcome to WISECONDOR
WISECONDOR is a set of python scripts that attempts to classify fetal aberrations in maternal blood samples. 
It was developed during my masters thesis at the [TU Delft Bioinformatics department](http://bioinformatics.tudelft.nl/) in collaboration with [VU Medical Center Amsterdam](http://www.vumc.com/), department of clinical genetics, and is currently used by several medical centers as a tool for non-invasive prenatal diagnostics.

The algorithm used was published in [Oxford Journals, Nucleic Acids Research, Online Methods](http://nar.oxfordjournals.org/content/early/2013/10/28/nar.gkt992.short) as an Open Access article.

### Authors and Contributors
WISECONDOR is mainly developed by Roy Straver (@rstraver) while being applied regularly by Daphne van Beek (@dvanbeek), therefore she also does some maintenance where necessary.

### Support or Contact
If you find anything unclear, please check out our [Wiki](https://github.com/rstraver/wisecondor/wiki) or create a ticket on our [Issues](https://github.com/rstraver/wisecondor/issues) page.
